questions.question: Is the vertical red "DALLAS" text present on the left side of the jersey?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the jersey design is simplified and focused on promoting the phrase 'Ride like likers a star!'. There is no visible text indicating 'DALLAS', as seen in the design elements of Image A.

questions.question: Is the tricolor patch (blue, black, red) present on the left sleeve?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the focus is on the blue color with a white star, and the design changes are aimed at the upper area such as the helmet and text layout. There is no visible tricolor patch on the sleeves.

questions.question: Is the red diagonal stripe running from the lower left to the upper right across the torso present?
questions.explanation: Image B features only blue-colored patterns and text, without the additional red diagonal stripe that is seen prominently across the torso area in Image A.

questions.question: Are the repeated faded gray "DALLAS" texts visible in the white section of the jersey?
questions.explanation: Image B employs a bold message with 'RIDE LIKE LIKERS A STAR!' over a blue section, removing any faded gray background text that is present in Image A.

questions.question: Is the placeholder text "YOUR NAME" visible in white on the blue panel?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the branding design is completely different, focusing on slogans rather than individual personalization such as 'YOUR NAME', which is present in Image A.

questions.question: Is the full-length front zipper visible along the center of the jersey?
questions.explanation: The design integrity of a cycling jersey includes the full-length front zipper for functional purposes, which is visible along the center in Image B.

questions.question: Is the high collar at the neckline of the jersey present?
questions.explanation: Images typically depict cycling jerseys with a high collar design for comfort and aerodynamics, which can be seen clearly in Image B.

questions.question: Is the black hem with a white inner lining visible at the bottom of the jersey?
questions.explanation: The black hem with a white inner lining is part of the typical design feature to enhance the jersey's durability and fit, which is visible at the bottom in Image B.

questions.question: Are the sleeves short and positioned at the shoulders?
questions.explanation: Short sleeves positioned at the shoulders are common in cycling jerseys for practicality and aerodynamics, visible in the jersey design of Image B.
